headline: 'Give that man $100,000 reward, not $50,000!' Crowd cheers New Jersey man, 21, who spotted shooter Frank James at East Village McDonald's moments BEFORE cops got there
author: James Gant
sentences: A 21-year-old Syrian man who caught the Brooklyn subway gunman was hailed a hero this afternoon after beating the NYPD to find the city's most wanted man.Zack Tahhan, who lives in New Jersey, told DailyMail.com how he recognized the alleged shooter while he was fixing a camera outside a convenience store in the East Village.Mr Tahhan, who works for MACA security integrators, revealed he immediately 'started jumping up and down and screaming' when he realized it was 62-year-old Frank James.He said onlookers 'thought he was crazy' but claimed he ran after him while the manager of the shop flagged down a police cruiser that had stopped at a red light.
